result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa A Chmiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (05/03/2019)

1:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court via telephone and without counsel.  Agent Luke Klein present in court via telephone.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation on both cases for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:17 p.m.
Probation review hearing on April 16, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: of hearing held on May 3, 2016, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Karen Blair - Court Reporter
of hearing held on February 29, 2016, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Jill M. Bartol - Court Reporter
of hearing held on November 10, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Jill M. Bartol - Court Reporter
of hearing held on January 14, 2016, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter
of hearing held on December 14, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter

4:17 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to counts 2 & 3 on 2015CF101 and count 1 on 2015CM131.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 2 and 3 on 2015CF101 and guilty on count 1 on 2015CM131.  Court orders count 1 on 2015CF101 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CF101 

Count 2

-30 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court allows huber for child care.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

Count 3

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-DNA sample
-Court costs.
-Court leaves it up to the agent as to what contact the defendant can have with Justin S.
-AODA and any follow-up
-Random UA's.

2015CM131

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-DNA sample
-Court costs.
-Court leaves it up to the agent as to what contact the defendant can have with Justin S.
-AODA and any follow-up
-Random UA's.
